summary: My friend gave me my first iron man pop!! Hes next to all my spider men. Also! Do you have any pop figures? dude they are so...
body:
My friend gave me my first iron man pop!! Hes next to all my spider men. Also! Do you have any pop figures?

dude they are so freaking cute omg I love them so much! and no, I dont have any unfortunately but im hoping to get some for my birthday this summer :D

blog.name: madasthesea
blog.title: There is no death, there is the Force
blog.description:
Senia. 24. Medieval Historian. A member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. 
"I know who I am now. I know who I want to be." 
AO3: madasthesea
Requests are currently closed

tags: and yes Tony does just pick Peter up and throw him onto a couch semi-regularly thanks for asking
question: Amuse me. :)
answer:
So this was inspired by that adorable headcanon that Peter is super light because of the spider bite. Also bonus Rhodey just cause.


Rhodey wasn’t used to Peter in a bad mood. He was usually optimism personified, Tony’s personal ray of sunshine. 

But today, he was sullen and distracted, barely answering even direct questions and staring into space. Rhodey would have assumed he was just not as peppy as Rhodey had thought–it’s not like he and Peter spent a ton of time together–but Tony was frowning over at him, too, a concerned crease between his eyebrows.

At one point, Peter walked to the kitchen and back out without stopping to grab anything, and then stood three feet from the couch, looking at his phone, as if he was so lost in thought he forgot to sit down.

“Alright,” Tony said quietly, “I’m intervening.”

Rhodey motioned for him to go ahead, eager to get their excited, happy Peter back. He figured Tony would sit the kid down and coax him into spilling like the responsible parent he was slowly morphing into. Instead, Tony watched Peter for a moment as if analyzing him, then he ran forward in a crouch like a rugby player, scooped the kid into his arms, and chucked him onto the couch cushions. 

Peter landed with a muffled “oomph,” his limbs flying everywhere. There was a beat of stillness where Rhodey’s jaw dropped and Peter blinked in shock.

Then the kid threw back his head and laughed.

That was apparently what Tony was waiting for, because he darted forward and pinned Peter to the couch, half-sitting, half-laying on him to hold him still. 

“What the–” Peter giggled.

“Tell me what’s wrong,” Tony said.

“Mr. Stark, get off.” He struggled against Tony’s hold, but Rhodey knew it was only for show. The kid could throw Tony across the room without even trying if he really wanted to. 

“Tell me.” Tony was grinning, and even though it made the crows feet at the corners of his eyes more pronounced, he looked younger than he had in years.

“You’re crushing me,” Peter wheezed dramatically.

“I resent the implication–” Tony caught both of Peter’s wrists in one hand so he’d stop halfheartedly pushing at Tony’s chest “–that I am heavier than a building.”

Peter’s groan was lost amid his laughter. 

“Tell me,” Tony said, poking Peter in the side and making him squirm. “Tell me, tell me, tell me.”

“Gah.”

Rhodey wasn’t even trying to hide how big he was smiling at this point, they were both totally oblivious to him anyway.

“I’ll tickle you til you tell me,” Tony threatened.

“I could just throw you off,” Peter reminded him. His smile broadened. “But you might break a hip.”

“Alright, for that you get a wet willie.” Tony raised a finger to his mouth and licked it.

“Ugh, that’s disgusting!” Peter protested, writhing more vigorously.

“Tell me!”

“Oscorp offered me a job!” Peter finally admitted, desperate to avoid such a juvenile punishment. 

Tony froze, seemingly so shocked he forgot to release the kid’s hands. “What?”

Peter looked up at Tony, his face torn. “An… an internship. In their biochemistry lab.”

Tony finally sat back, letting Peter sit up. He was biting his lip. “But… you already have an internship. Here.”

Peter shrugged. “Well, I mean… not really. That’s just what we tell people.”

Tony scoffed. “Kid, what do you think all that time in the lab is? It’s better experience than cleaning Osborn’s petri dishes, that’s for sure.”

Peter fiddled with his phone. “College applications are coming up. It’d look really good.”

Tony finally looked at Rhodey, as if remembering he was in the room for the first time. He looked a little heartbroken. “Do you… I mean, if you’d rather work there, Pete, I won’t… I won’t stop you.”

“No!” Peter exclaimed, looking up Tony. “I just… they said they could write me a really nice letter of recommendation so I can get a good scholarship.”

Tony held up his hands in a time out sign. “Woah, woah, woah. A letter of recommendation? Peter, I’ve had a letter of recommendation written up for you since, like, the day you stopped Vulture. I update it monthly, since you never stop blowing my mind. And as for scholarships, you know I’m paying for you. Where is all this coming from?”

Peter squirmed again, this time under the weight of Tony’s stare. Rhodey was trying to make himself as invisible as possible. 

“I just thought you might… change your mind or something,” Peter muttered. 

Tony looked horribly sad for a second, but he seemed to shake it off. He reached up and pushed Peter’s bangs back so he could drop a quick kiss on his forehead. “Someday, kid, you’re going to stop doubting how much you mean to me.”

There was a long moment where Peter and Tony just looked at each other, and whatever was passed between them made the heaviness in the room suddenly ease. Peter slumped into Tony’s side without preamble.

“I cannot believe you were going to give me a wet willie. That’s so immature, Mr. Stark.”

Tony laughed. “Would you have gone to work for Oscorp if I did?”

“Yes,” Peter lied. Tony just chuckled again, looking up and meeting Rhodey’s eyes as if to say ‘this kid, am I right?’ Rhodey just shrugged, smiling. He thought they were a perfect pair, but he wasn’t going to tell Tony that.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Got Milk?
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2VrnVtn

by Dodo

It’s happened before during WWII and Steve had honestly forgotten about it, but now it’s happening again. He thinks it has to do with the duress of coming back to the tower after being pardoned, after the events of civil war. his body is trying to help his team, bond or something. He hopes he can keep it a secret.

Words: 1853, Chapters: 1/3, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of The Cheese Stands Alone

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Bruce Banner, James “Bucky” Barnes, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Steve Rogers, Tony Stark
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Male Lactation, Milking, Overprotective Bucky


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2VrnVtn

summary:
Peter: It is because of that I am proud to stand before you today.
Reporter: Mr.Parker, there are quite a lot of people out...
body:
Peter: It is because of that I am proud to stand before you today.

Reporter: Mr.Parker, there are quite a lot of people out there in the world calling you just the Stark 2.0. What is your response?

Peter: Well that implies that I’m just the better version of him and in a way yes, I am 2.0. That is because I have the benefit of experience passed on to me by my predecessor . I have seen the road he took and life and went forward to continue where he left off.

Reporter: Some have said you are nothing more then a spoiled child doomed to repeat Tony Starks mistakes. Your response?

Peter: I wouldn’t use the word spoiled but yes I was given much due to my relation to Mr.Stark. I’m sure anyone would do the same for their child. But like I said part of parenting is preventing such mistakes.

Reporter: Are you the secret love child of Stark?

Peter: This may come as a surprise to many but no such child exists and that is all I’ll say on that subject.

Reporter: One last question, what make you feel confident un taking over your father’s business.

Peter: Well after joining the Stark household I inherited not just a father but a family. I was educated by the avengers in every possible subject. Science, biology,business, history, martial arts, foreign language, sign language and a few other. They have prepared my with every possible life skill I’d need and while I’m not the best at all those things, I’m confident that I’m not lacking in knowledge of how to run Stark industries.

blog.name: doctornineandthreequarters
blog.title: Trapped in the moment, ready to fly.
blog.description: Jaime, 26, she/her. I'm here to reblog the things I like and rant about the weirdness of the world. Join me on my strange journey. Ao3: doctornineandthreequarters

summary: Under the Weather - doctornineandthreequarters - Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Under the Weather - doctornineandthreequarters - Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Sometimes, when you’re sick, you write an Irondad and Spiderson sick fic to make yourself feel better. Enjoy!

Sniff.

Tony turned to his left, finally finding the creator of the offending sound. Peter sat at the other side of the table, rubbing his nose with his sleeve. He grimaced a little, acknowledging to himself how gross it was to use one’s sleeve as a tissue. Peter made a few more noises and then wiped his eyes.

blog.name: mariiahills
blog.title: ah. that thing was squeezing my brain.

summary: pepper potts does not like violence. it’s ironic, coming from a woman that’s engaged to iron man, a woman that had her own iron...
body:
pepper potts does not like violence. it’s ironic, coming from a woman that’s engaged to iron man, a woman that had her own iron suit, a woman that has killed a man. a woman that had- has extremis.

it’s really ironic, really, because she’s strapped into the iron suit, with that kid from, what? five years ago? the kid that tony talks about.

they’re there, and they’re both in iron suit, both about to fly into spacme, to save her fiancé and the robot.

rhodes is taking care of the company, thank his for that. she’s met up with the rogue avengers, and it’s weird, seeing the people who you used to talk with, live with, try to kill your fiancé, and then have to work with them.

so yeah, she’s here now, flying into space, knowing she’s going to have to be violent.

blog.name: tonylovedthestarstoofondly
blog.title: and now he's fearful of the night

summary: You know, sometimes Steve wishes his best friend wasn’t such a diva. He did love Bucky’s cooking, and he was grateful he did all...
body:
You know, sometimes Steve wishes his best friend wasn’t such a diva.

He did love Bucky’s cooking, and he was grateful he did all the cooking, but now Steve was standing in the middle of a grocery store at 3 am because Bucky had to have a specific type of rice for a dish he was going to try. Not that it wouldn’t turn out great, but he found it hard to think about that when he was staring at seventeen types of rice that all looked identical to him other than a millimeter difference that apparently separated ‘short’ and ‘long’ rice.

And of course, the specific rice Bucky had to have was on the very highest shelf, made for the gargantuan people that had clearly sold their souls to the fae for the extra inches.

Assholes.

This was fine, if he just positioned his cart over here, and then balanced his foot there and stretched his hand..

“DUMMY DON’T TOUCH THAT!” a voice said from around the corner and Steve’s foot slipped as he tried to twist in alarm, sending him crashing down. He blinked dazedly up as the sound of hasty footsteps and squeaky wheels approached and then someone appeared in Steve’s line of view.

“You’re pretty,” he mumbled, registering the blush on the other guys face. “Ah, not dead?”

“Ah…no,” he said, “Let’s get you up. No Dummy, you hold the cart, we don’t wanna break the man’s arm if you try pulling him up. There we go.”

“I can get up,” Steve grumpily said, hauling himself out of the cart basket. “You shouldn’t call your friends dumm-that….is a robot.”

The robot in question beeped and clicked at him, moving its camera? claw? Closer to his face and making another odd clicking sound.

“Meet dummy!” the man said, bouncing on his heels. “He’s ridiculous, and doesn’t understand that squeezing tomatoes will cause them to burst.”

Indeed, the man was covered in what looked like tomato guts, staining the large hoodie he was wearing.

“Still mean, to call a robot Dummy.” Steve said cautiously.

“It’s technically D U M dash E.” he sighed, “I was drunk when he was born, and he decided to pick the first word he heard as his name. Sorry about startling you, I didn’t think that anyone other than the poor cashiers would be here.”

“My roommate wants to try a dish, and he needs a specific rice or else he’ll dramatically lie on the couch and moan about betrayal and pretend he’s talking about soap operas.” Steve said with a sigh, tilting his head back and starting again at the stupid rice above him. He was not going to address the drinking comment, wasn’t really his business after all.

“Ah, mine gives me puppy eyes of sadness if I don’t eat something other than granola bars and coffee so therefore, shopping.” he said, waving around an honest to god shopping list. “And the last time I left DUM-E alone in my room, he smashed the coffee-maker.” The robot in question beeped, and somehow managed to sound indignant. “You did not do it on accident, I know Rhodey put you up to it!”

“I take it you haven’t been shopping often?” Steve said, reluctantly charmed.

“Did the tomato pieces give that away?” the stranger said wryly, making Steve laugh.

“A little bit.” Steve said in amusement.

“Alright handsome, let’s make a deal.” he said mischievously, and Steve flushed slightly at the unexpected endearment. “DUM-E will get down your friends rice, and then you help me find ‘fresh yeast’ along with where they moved the cranberry sauce and the dried fruit because I swear the last time I was here they were in one place but I can’t find it now.”

“They always move that around, I don’t understand why.” Steve sighed, “I’ll show you, I’ve been here enough times chasing after Bucky’s ‘potato dumpling whitener’ or some other random thing.”

The stranger smiled widely, and Steve quietly thought ‘I’m screwed’ to himself as he stuck out his hand.

“Steve.”

“Tony.”

~~~

For @makopanda on the Stark Industries United server! Hope you like it!

Indeed, the man was covered in what looked like tomato guts, staining the large hoodie he was wearing.

“Still mean, to call a robot Dummy.” Steve said cautiously.

“It’s technically D U M dash E.” he sighed, “I was drunk when he was born, and he decided to pick the first word he heard as his name. Sorry about startling you, I didn’t think that anyone other than the poor cashiers would be here.”

“My roommate wants to try a dish, and he needs a specific rice or else he’ll dramatically lie on the couch and moan about betrayal and pretend he’s talking about soap operas.” Steve said with a sigh, tilting his head back and starting again at the stupid rice above him. He was not going to address the drinking comment, wasn’t really his business after all.

“Ah, mine gives me puppy eyes of sadness if I don’t eat something other than granola bars and coffee so therefore, shopping.” he said, waving around an honest to god shopping list. “And the last time I left DUM-E alone in my room, he smashed the coffee-maker.” The robot in question beeped, and somehow managed to sound indignant. “You did not do it on accident, I know Rhodey put you up to it!”

“I take it you haven’t been shopping often?” Steve said, reluctantly charmed.

“Did the tomato pieces give that away?” the stranger said wryly, making Steve laugh.

“A little bit.” Steve said in amusement.

“Alright handsome, let’s make a deal.” he said mischievously, and Steve flushed slightly at the unexpected endearment. “DUM-E will get down your friends rice, and then you help me find ‘fresh yeast’ along with where they moved the cranberry sauce and the dried fruit because I swear the last time I was here they were in one place but I can’t find it now.”

“They always move that around, I don’t understand why.” Steve sighed, “I’ll show you, I’ve been here enough times chasing after Bucky’s ‘potato dumpling whitener’ or some other random thing.”

The stranger smiled widely, and Steve quietly thought ‘I’m screwed’ to himself as he stuck out his hand.

“Steve.”

“Tony.”

~~~

For @makopanda on the Stark Industries United server! Hope you like it!
trail.content:
You know, sometimes Steve wishes his best friend wasn’t such a diva.

He did love Bucky’s cooking, and he was grateful he did all the cooking, but now Steve was standing in the middle of a grocery store at 3 am because Bucky had to have a specific type of rice for a dish he was going to try. Not that it wouldn’t turn out great, but he found it hard to think about that when he was staring at seventeen types of rice that all looked identical to him other than a millimeter difference that apparently separated ‘short’ and ‘long’ rice.

And of course, the specific rice Bucky had to have was on the very highest shelf, made for the gargantuan people that had clearly sold their souls to the fae for the extra inches.

Assholes.

This was fine, if he just positioned his cart over here, and then balanced his foot there and stretched his hand..

“DUMMY DON’T TOUCH THAT!” a voice said from around the corner and Steve’s foot slipped as he tried to twist in alarm, sending him crashing down. He blinked dazedly up as the sound of hasty footsteps and squeaky wheels approached and then someone appeared in Steve’s line of view.

“You’re pretty,” he mumbled, registering the blush on the other guys face. “Ah, not dead?”

“Ah…no,” he said, “Let’s get you up. No Dummy, you hold the cart, we don’t wanna break the man’s arm if you try pulling him up. There we go.”

“I can get up,” Steve grumpily said, hauling himself out of the cart basket. “You shouldn’t call your friends dumm-that….is a robot.”

The robot in question beeped and clicked at him, moving its camera? claw? Closer to his face and making another odd clicking sound.

“Meet dummy!” the man said, bouncing on his heels. “He’s ridiculous, and doesn’t understand that squeezing tomatoes will cause them to burst.”

Indeed, the man was covered in what looked like tomato guts, staining the large hoodie he was wearing.

“Still mean, to call a robot Dummy.” Steve said cautiously.

“It’s technically D U M dash E.” he sighed, “I was drunk when he was born, and he decided to pick the first word he heard as his name. Sorry about startling you, I didn’t think that anyone other than the poor cashiers would be here.”

“My roommate wants to try a dish, and he needs a specific rice or else he’ll dramatically lie on the couch and moan about betrayal and pretend he’s talking about soap operas.” Steve said with a sigh, tilting his head back and starting again at the stupid rice above him. He was not going to address the drinking comment, wasn’t really his business after all.

“Ah, mine gives me puppy eyes of sadness if I don’t eat something other than granola bars and coffee so therefore, shopping.” he said, waving around an honest to god shopping list. “And the last time I left DUM-E alone in my room, he smashed the coffee-maker.” The robot in question beeped, and somehow managed to sound indignant. “You did not do it on accident, I know Rhodey put you up to it!”

“I take it you haven’t been shopping often?” Steve said, reluctantly charmed.

“Did the tomato pieces give that away?” the stranger said wryly, making Steve laugh.

“A little bit.” Steve said in amusement.

“Alright handsome, let’s make a deal.” he said mischievously, and Steve flushed slightly at the unexpected endearment. “DUM-E will get down your friends rice, and then you help me find ‘fresh yeast’ along with where they moved the cranberry sauce and the dried fruit because I swear the last time I was here they were in one place but I can’t find it now.”

“They always move that around, I don’t understand why.” Steve sighed, “I’ll show you, I’ve been here enough times chasing after Bucky’s ‘potato dumpling whitener’ or some other random thing.”

The stranger smiled widely, and Steve quietly thought ‘I’m screwed’ to himself as he stuck out his hand.

“Steve.”

“Tony.”

~~~

For @makopanda on the Stark Industries United server! Hope you like it!
